rc3BootRomVer.name: rc3BootRomVer
rc3BootRomVer.description: Boot Rom Software version, in the form 'major.minor[letters]'. If the version is unknown or not avaliable then the value should be a zero length string.

rc3FirmwareVer.name: rc3FirmwareVer
rc3FirmwareVer.description: Software version, in the form 'major.minor[letters]'. If the version is unknown or not avaliable then the value should be a zero length string.

rc3FirmwareID.name: rc3FirmwareID
rc3FirmwareID.description: A Textual description to identify the firmware on the Ravlin.

rc3HardwareVer.name: rc3HardwareVer
rc3HardwareVer.description: Hardware version, in the form 'major.minor[letters]'. If the version is unknown or not avaliable then the value should be a zero length string.

rc3DistinguishedName.name: rc3DistinguishedName
rc3DistinguishedName.description: Factory Assigned Unique Security ID for the Ravlin Unit. It consists of three parts of the form 'mmmCK-xxx-sssss'. mmm - is the model number. CK - is a single digit checksum xxx,sssss - is a sequence number.

rc3HostName.name: rc3HostName
rc3HostName.description: Host name assigned to the Ravlin unit. If host name exists, then it is used as the DHCP host name, else rcDistinguishedName is used. Hence the name must be unique in a single DHCP scope. Max Size for Host name is 15 characters.

rc3InterfaceTable.name: rc3InterfaceTable
rc3InterfaceTable.description: Interface table, for the Ravlin unit. This is a fixed sized table. The size of the table is determined by the value of ifNumber. Entries cannot be added or deleted.

rc3InterfaceEntry.name: rc3InterfaceEntry
rc3InterfaceEntry.description: An interface entry containing objects at the subnetwork layer and below for a particular interface.

rc3InterfaceIp.name: rc3InterfaceIp
rc3InterfaceIp.description: The interface's address at the network layer in the protocol stack.

rc3InterfaceMask.name: rc3InterfaceMask
rc3InterfaceMask.description: The subnet mask associated with the IP address of this entry. The value of the mask is an IP address with all the network bits set to 1 and all the hosts bits set to 0.

rc3InterfaceMac.name: rc3InterfaceMac
rc3InterfaceMac.description: The interface's address at the protocol layer immediately `below' the network layer in the protocol stack. For interfaces which do not have such an address (e.g., a serial line), this object should contain an octet string of zero length.

rc3IpRouteTable.name: rc3IpRouteTable
rc3IpRouteTable.description: The routing table for this Ravlin.

rc3IpRouteEntry.name: rc3IpRouteEntry
rc3IpRouteEntry.description: A route to a particular destination.

rc3IpRouteDest.name: rc3IpRouteDest
rc3IpRouteDest.description: The destination IP address of this route. An entry with a value of 0.0.0.0 is considered a default route. This value should be logical-ANDed with the rc3IpRouteMask prior to being added to the table.

rc3IpRouteMask.name: rc3IpRouteMask
rc3IpRouteMask.description: Indicates the mask that will be logical-ANDed with the destination address before being compared to the value in the rc3IpRouteDest field.

rc3IpRouteIfIndex.name: rc3IpRouteIfIndex
rc3IpRouteIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the local interface through which the next hop of this route should be reached.

rc3IpRouteNextHop.name: rc3IpRouteNextHop
rc3IpRouteNextHop.description: The IP address of the next hop of this route.

rc3IpRouteMetric.name: rc3IpRouteMetric
rc3IpRouteMetric.description: The primary routing metric for this route.

rc3IpRouteProto.name: rc3IpRouteProto
rc3IpRouteProto.description: The routing mechanism via which this route was learned.

rc3IpRouteAge.name: rc3IpRouteAge
rc3IpRouteAge.description: The number of seconds since this route was last updated or otherwise determined to be correct.

rc3IpRouteRowStatus.name: rc3IpRouteRowStatus
rc3IpRouteRowStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the IP Route Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used. On read status indicates ACTIVE.

rc3PacketHandlingOptions.name: rc3PacketHandlingOptions
rc3PacketHandlingOptions.description: This is Bit Masked Object. Zero or more bits can be set or cleared. Bit 0 - Forward non-IP Traffic in Bridge Mode Bit 1 - Forward Local IP Traffic in Bridge Mode Bit 2 - Forward MAC Broadcast in Bridge Mode Bit 3 - Forward IP Broadcast in Router Mode Bit 4 - Send ICMP Re-Direct Messages in Router Mode Bit 5 - Forward Multicast Bit 6 - ARP proxy on the Remote Port Bit 7 - Ignore Don't frag bit. Default is disable. In default mode, if - the Don't frag bit is set, and packets needs to be fragmented - then Ravlin will send ICMP back to the sender and drop the packet. Bit 8 - NAT packets matching bypass selector list. Bit 9 - SNMP access on Remote port in clear. Default is enabled. If disabled then the ONLY way to access the device from the Remote side is to manage it via a tunnel. Note - 0 Allow SNMP on remote in the clear. - 1 Allow SNMP on remote thru. the tunnel. -- Enable/Disable is reversed for bit 9 to avoid hassles in backward -- compatibility Bit 10 - Enable/Disable PPPoE on Remote Port - Default is disable. Note - 1 Enable - 0 Disable Bit 11 - Enable/Disable PPPoE connect on Demand - Default is disable. Note - 1 Enable - 0 Disable Bit 29 - Enable/Disable listening to unsolicited ARP on local port. Default is disable. Note - 1 Enable - 0 Disable Bit 30 - Enable/Disable cascading packets from one gateway to another. Default is disable. Note - 1 Enable - 0 Disable The flags specifying behavior for bridge mode are ignored when the device is in router mode, and the flags specifying behavior for router mode are ignored when the device is in bridge mode.

rc3PPPoEUserPassword.name: rc3PPPoEUserPassword
rc3PPPoEUserPassword.description: User Password. Password will be encrypted by RNM when doing a set. Get for user password

rc3PPPoEIdleTimeout.name: rc3PPPoEIdleTimeout
rc3PPPoEIdleTimeout.description: The duration in minutes to timeout PPPoE connection when there is no traffic.Default is 10 minutes.

rc3PPPoERetryCount.name: rc3PPPoERetryCount
rc3PPPoERetryCount.description: Retry count for PPPoE. Default is 10.

rc3PPPoEDnsServer1.name: rc3PPPoEDnsServer1
rc3PPPoEDnsServer1.description: IP address of DNS server1. When Ravlin is enabled to get its remote interface attributes via PPPoE, it will also provide DNS server IP address. This is a read-only attribute, the user can use to setup his end host.

rc3PPPoEDnsServer2.name: rc3PPPoEDnsServer2
rc3PPPoEDnsServer2.description: IP address of DNS server1. When Ravlin is enabled to get its remote interface attributes via PPPoE, it will also provide DNS server IP address. This is a read-only attribute, the user can use to setup his end host.

rc3Reset.name: rc3Reset
rc3Reset.description: Action object to do the following: warmstart - Reboots the device. Firmware and configuration information is maintained. clearallactiveSA - All active SA entries are removed. clearARPcache - All entries in the ARP cache are removed. clearmessagetable - All entries in the status message table will be removed. resettodefaults - IP address and subnet mask are maintained. All other configuration information is removed. Firmware is maintained. resettofactorydefaults - All configuration information is removed. Firmware is maintained. eraseflash - Firmware is removed and the device will be in BOOT ROM mode. Configuration information is maintained. disablebox - Delete Box's manufactured certificate and private key. ** ** WARNING: this function will render the Ravlin box useless. ** Use only when device is no longer required to be in service FOREVER. **

rc3ArpCacheCleanupInterval.name: rc3ArpCacheCleanupInterval
rc3ArpCacheCleanupInterval.description: The duration in minutes to cleanup ARP cache.

rc3Password.name: rc3Password
rc3Password.description: Object used to set new password for the box. For SNMP set operations the password is encrypted. The key for encrypt/Decrypt is generated by hashing the old password and a selector value. The default password is 1234. On read an octet string of zero length is returned.

rc3OperationalMode.name: rc3OperationalMode
rc3OperationalMode.description: The desired state of the Ravlin. For the passall and vpnready modes, the device will act as either a router or a bridge depending on the configuration of the network interfaces. If the two interfaces are on the same network, then the device will function as a bridge, otherwise it will function as a router. passall - all traffic either in bridge or router mode. blockall - drop all incoming packets. vpnready - use the policy database and configuration flags to determine which traffic to pass, block, or apply security. standby - (READ-ONLY) drop all incoming packets, until the device configuration is not complete. EUse this mode, when the remote interface has DHCP or PPPoE enabled.

rc3InactiveClientTimeout.name: rc3InactiveClientTimeout
rc3InactiveClientTimeout.description: The duration in minutes to tear down the SA between the RavSoft client and Ravlin server.

rc3DHCPServerIP.name: rc3DHCPServerIP
rc3DHCPServerIP.description: IP Address of the DHCP server. This address can ONLY configured manually by SNMP.

rc3DHCPRequest.name: rc3DHCPRequest
rc3DHCPRequest.description: This is Bit Masked Object. Zero or more bits can be set or cleared. Bit 0 - Enable/Disable DHCP on the Local Port Bit 1 - Enable/Disable DHCP on the Remote Port Bit 2 - Tunnel local host's DHCP request If the Bit is set, then DHCP is enabled, else it is disabled. By default DHCP is enabled on both ports.

rc3PasswordFips.name: rc3PasswordFips
rc3PasswordFips.description: Available for release 3.30 and up. Object used to set new password for the box. Refer to the textual convention of PbeShaEncryptedObject, for the process used to set this object. The default password is 1234. On read an octet string of zero length is returned. Password string size (1..20)

rc3DHCPRelayIpAddr.name: rc3DHCPRelayIpAddr
rc3DHCPRelayIpAddr.description: IP Address to be used for DHCP Relay. This is used when the Ravlin unit redeives a DHCP request from the Ravsoft client.

rc3SysPerfTimeBetweenPolls.name: rc3SysPerfTimeBetweenPolls
rc3SysPerfTimeBetweenPolls.description: Time in seconds after which the polling will occur. A value of 0 means that this Ravlin will not poll. Default value is zero(0). The minimum value can be set is 30 seconds and maximum is 600 seconds.

rc3SysPerfTimeBetweenReports.name: rc3SysPerfTimeBetweenReports
rc3SysPerfTimeBetweenReports.description: Time in seconds after which reporting will occur.

rc3SysPerfTrapThreshold.name: rc3SysPerfTrapThreshold
rc3SysPerfTrapThreshold.description: This is the threshold of packet loss below which a warning trap will be generated. This threshold is measured in percentage of packets sent versus packets received.

rc3DHCPBroadcastIntf.name: rc3DHCPBroadcastIntf
rc3DHCPBroadcastIntf.description: Indentify the interface to broadcast DHCP requests. When the DHCP server IP Address is not a broadcast address, then SNMP agent will return a value of notApplicable. Manager CANNOT set this object to notApplicable.

rc3StateLessDHCP.name: rc3StateLessDHCP
rc3StateLessDHCP.description: Enables a head end device not to keep state information for DHCP records, used in DHCP relay. This will allow head end to be in cluster topology. When enabled, DHCP records will exchanged via ISAKMP private notify messages after ISAKMP SA is established. If disabled then DHCP records are saved in NVM.

rc3SigFailCount.name: rc3SigFailCount
rc3SigFailCount.description: Indicates number of times the signature failed.

rc3StatusMsgTable.name: rc3StatusMsgTable
rc3StatusMsgTable.description: The table containing the status messages for this device. This entire table is read-only.

rc3StatusMsgEntry.name: rc3StatusMsgEntry
rc3StatusMsgEntry.description: An entry in the status message table. For status messages that repeat, only one entry is used, and the rc3EventCodeRepetitions filed identifies the number of consecutive messages of that type that have occurred. This should prevent the table from being wiped out by a series of consecutive messages of the same type. The entire table can be cleared using rc3Reset.

rc3StatusMsgIndex.name: rc3StatusMsgIndex
rc3StatusMsgIndex.description: This value is used as a unique identifier for each entry.

rc3FirstInTimeStamp.name: rc3FirstInTimeStamp
rc3FirstInTimeStamp.description: The time when this message was first generated.

rc3LastInTimeStamp.name: rc3LastInTimeStamp
rc3LastInTimeStamp.description: The time when this message was last generated.

rc3EventCode.name: rc3EventCode
rc3EventCode.description: An identifier of the event caused the status message to be generated.

rc3EventCodeRepetitions.name: rc3EventCodeRepetitions
rc3EventCodeRepetitions.description: The number of times in a row this event occurred.

rc3EventSpecificDescr1.name: rc3EventSpecificDescr1
rc3EventSpecificDescr1.description: If the event code maps to a string that contains '%1', this value will be substituted for the '%1' when the string is displayed.

rc3EventSpecificDescr2.name: rc3EventSpecificDescr2
rc3EventSpecificDescr2.description: If the event code maps to a string that contains '%2', this value will be substituted for the '%2' when the string is displayed.

rc3SysLogServerIP.name: rc3SysLogServerIP
rc3SysLogServerIP.description: IP Address of the syslog server.

rc3SysLogPortNum.name: rc3SysLogPortNum
rc3SysLogPortNum.description: Port number for the syslog service.

rc3SysLogMsgLevel.name: rc3SysLogMsgLevel
rc3SysLogMsgLevel.description: Specify how verbose the message logging should be.

rc3SysLogServerTable.name: rc3SysLogServerTable
rc3SysLogServerTable.description: The table containing the list of syslog server IP Address, syslog port, and priority of syslog message it will receive.

rc3SysLogServerEntry.name: rc3SysLogServerEntry
rc3SysLogServerEntry.description: An entry in the syslog server table. This table can have zero to five entries.

rc3SysLogServerIp.name: rc3SysLogServerIp
rc3SysLogServerIp.description: This value is used as a unique identifier for each entry.

rc3SysLogServerPort.name: rc3SysLogServerPort
rc3SysLogServerPort.description: This value is used as a unique identifier for each entry.

rc3SysLogPriorityLevel.name: rc3SysLogPriorityLevel
rc3SysLogPriorityLevel.description: Specify how verbose the message logging should be.

rc3SysLogMsgStatus.name: rc3SysLogMsgStatus
rc3SysLogMsgStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the SYSLOG server Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used. On read status indicates ACTIVE.

rc3ReadCommunityString.name: rc3ReadCommunityString
rc3ReadCommunityString.description: This object is used to change Read Community string public. For SNMP set operations the string is encrypted. The key for encrypt/Decrypt is generated by hashing the password and a selector value. This object will return NULL for get/getnext.

rc3WriteCommunityString.name: rc3WriteCommunityString
rc3WriteCommunityString.description: This object is used to change Write Community string private. For SNMP set operations the string is encrypted. The key for encrypt/Decrypt is generated by hashing the password and a selector value. This object will return NULL for get/getnext.

rc3TrapRcvrTable.name: rc3TrapRcvrTable
rc3TrapRcvrTable.description: A Table to register SNMP Manager IP Address and community string to receive TRAP's from Ravlin Unit. This table can have a maximum of 5 entries.

rc3TrapRcvrEntry.name: rc3TrapRcvrEntry
rc3TrapRcvrEntry.description: A row in the Trap Receiver Table. Rows in this table can be created or Deleted.

rc3TrapRcvrIpAddr.name: rc3TrapRcvrIpAddr
rc3TrapRcvrIpAddr.description: The IP Address of the SNMP Manager that would receive TRAP.

rc3TrapRcvrComm.name: rc3TrapRcvrComm
rc3TrapRcvrComm.description: Community string used by SNMP Manager.

rc3TrapRcvrType.name: rc3TrapRcvrType
rc3TrapRcvrType.description: Specifies the types of TRAPS that this manager should received.

rc3TrapRcvrStatus.name: rc3TrapRcvrStatus
rc3TrapRcvrStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the TRAP Receiver Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used. On read status indicates ACTIVE.

rc3SnmpErrorCode.name: rc3SnmpErrorCode
rc3SnmpErrorCode.description: This object will return the reason for the last SNMP SET error. Since SNMPv1 has a limited number of error codes, this object provides an extension to report specific enterprise errors.

rc3ReadCommunityStringFips.name: rc3ReadCommunityStringFips
rc3ReadCommunityStringFips.description: Available for release 3.30 and up. Object used to set read community string for this device. Refer to the textual convention of PbeShaEncryptedObject, for the process used to set this object. The default ReadCommunityString is 'public'. On read an octet string of zero length is returned. read community string SIZE(1..20)

rc3WriteCommunityStringFips.name: rc3WriteCommunityStringFips
rc3WriteCommunityStringFips.description: Available for release 3.30 and up. Object used to set write community string for this device. Refer to the textual convention of PbeShaEncryptedObject, for the process used to set this object. The default WriteCommunityString is 'private'. On read an octet string of zero length is returned. write community string SIZE(1..20)

rc3ClientAuthentication.name: rc3ClientAuthentication
rc3ClientAuthentication.description: Enable or Disable client Authentication. There are two Authentication methods. Either RADIUS or LOCAL. Client Authentication is not avaliable on the personal Ravlin.

rc3ActiveRadiusServer.name: rc3ActiveRadiusServer
rc3ActiveRadiusServer.description: Specify the current active RADIUS server by its IP Address. If this RADIUS server is not responding, then the agent will direct RADIUS requests to the next preferred RADIUS server in the list, and accordingly change the value of this object to indicate the active server.

rc3RadiusPriority.name: rc3RadiusPriority
rc3RadiusPriority.description: Specify the priority of the Radius servers in the table. Each octet will specify one of the entries in order of preference.

rc3RadiusAuthServerTable.name: rc3RadiusAuthServerTable
rc3RadiusAuthServerTable.description: Table, to setup Primary and/or Secondary Authentication Server. This is a fixed sized table. RADIUS packets will be routed to their destination using the Route Table.

rc3RadiusAuthServerEntry.name: rc3RadiusAuthServerEntry
rc3RadiusAuthServerEntry.description: RADIUS Auth Server entry containing all the attributes required to configure Auth Server. There will be a maximum of three entries in the table. If rc3RadiusAuthServerIP is 0.0.0.0, then that row is not used.

rc3RadiusAuthServerEntryIndx.name: rc3RadiusAuthServerEntryIndx
rc3RadiusAuthServerEntryIndx.description: A unique identifier for the entry in this table. Valid values are 1-3.

rc3RadiusAuthServerIP.name: rc3RadiusAuthServerIP
rc3RadiusAuthServerIP.description: The IP Address (Network Address), of the RADIUS Authentication server.

rc3RadiusAuthServerPort.name: rc3RadiusAuthServerPort
rc3RadiusAuthServerPort.description: Specifies the UDP port number used by the RADIUS service on the Authentication Server.

rc3RadiusAttributeOffset.name: rc3RadiusAttributeOffset
rc3RadiusAttributeOffset.description: If zero, then use vendor specific attributes. Otherwise this object specifies the first offset to use for the RedCreek attribute values.

rc3RadiusAuthServerSharedSecret.name: rc3RadiusAuthServerSharedSecret
rc3RadiusAuthServerSharedSecret.description: This is the shared secret between the Ravlin and Radius Server. For SNMP set operations the string is encrypted. The key for encrypt/Decrypt is generated by hashing the password and a selector value. This object will return NULL for get/getnext.

rc3RadiusAuthServerRetries.name: rc3RadiusAuthServerRetries
rc3RadiusAuthServerRetries.description: This limits the number of retries with the Authentication Server. Default is 3. Maximum is 5. Min is 1

rc3RadiusAuthServerSharedSecretFips.name: rc3RadiusAuthServerSharedSecretFips
rc3RadiusAuthServerSharedSecretFips.description: Available for release 3.30 and up. Object used to set shared secret key between the Ravlin and Radius Server. Refer to the textual convention of PbeShaEncryptedObject, for the process used to set this object. If the preshared key exists, then on read a dummy string is returned. shared secret key length is (0..32)

rc3LocalAuthTable.name: rc3LocalAuthTable
rc3LocalAuthTable.description: Table to maintain the database of user name, password and static virtual IP Address and Mask.

rc3LocalAuthEntry.name: rc3LocalAuthEntry
rc3LocalAuthEntry.description: Entries in this table can be added and deleted.

rc3LocalAuthId.name: rc3LocalAuthId
rc3LocalAuthId.description: A unique value for each entry.

rc3LocalAuthName.name: rc3LocalAuthName
rc3LocalAuthName.description: User name, used to logon and get authenticated. When password is read it will return a NULL string.

rc3LocalAuthPassword.name: rc3LocalAuthPassword
rc3LocalAuthPassword.description: Password for the user, to authenticated with

rc3LocalAuthRowStatus.name: rc3LocalAuthRowStatus
rc3LocalAuthRowStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the IP Route Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used. On read status indicates ACTIVE.

rc3ImageSize.name: rc3ImageSize
rc3ImageSize.description: Size of Image in bytes. SNMP manager must send this value before it can do a software download. On receipt of this object the AGENT will allocate the memory of rc3ImageSize, and start a 60 second timer. If the Agent does not receive the actual software block within the timeout period, it will assume the software download is aborted.

rc3SoftwareBlock.name: rc3SoftwareBlock
rc3SoftwareBlock.description: A block of software image to be downloaded to the flash. AGENT uses a 60 second timer to timeout and abort software download, if no more block is received. On read the AGENT returns a zero length (NULL) string.

rc3SoftwareBlockNumber.name: rc3SoftwareBlockNumber
rc3SoftwareBlockNumber.description: A sequential counter to keep track of the block number of the image that is sent by the SNMP Manager.

rc3RandomNumber.name: rc3RandomNumber
rc3RandomNumber.description: A new Random number is used for every set hash computation. After the set operation is successful, the Ravlin changes the random number value, thus preventing replay.

rc3HashObject.name: rc3HashObject
rc3HashObject.description: Image checksum/hash, after the last block of Image download is completed. On this indication the AGENT will do a checksum verification, and if correct will write the Image to the flash. If download Image checksum is incorrect then returns 'Gen Err'.

rc3UlaAuthenticationTimer.name: rc3UlaAuthenticationTimer
rc3UlaAuthenticationTimer.description: The duration in minutes to re-authenticate a user for gateway access. Minimum is 30 minutes.

rc3UlaAuthenticationPort.name: rc3UlaAuthenticationPort
rc3UlaAuthenticationPort.description: UDP port used for ULA authentication. By default the Ravlin will send to the RADIUS port 1812.

rc3SystemTime.name: rc3SystemTime
rc3SystemTime.description: This object reads the current system time in GMT.

rc3CACertTable.name: rc3CACertTable
rc3CACertTable.description: Table containing the CA certificates and public keys that can be used to verify User Certificate. The index value of 1 and 2 is reserved for RedCreek CA certificate that is manufactured into the box. Attempts to modify this entry will return generic error. A total of upto 6 CA certificates can be added.

rc3CACertEntry.name: rc3CACertEntry
rc3CACertEntry.description: The entries in this table indicate that trust has been established for this root CA. Entries in the Policy Database will list an issuer name that is trusted, and the certificate for that issuer should reside in this table.

rc3CACertIndex.name: rc3CACertIndex
rc3CACertIndex.description: A unique identifier for this certificate in this table.

rc3CACertName.name: rc3CACertName
rc3CACertName.description: Textual string used to identify a CA certificate.

rc3CACertData.name: rc3CACertData
rc3CACertData.description: The x509v3 DER encoded CA certificate.

rc3CACertStatus.name: rc3CACertStatus
rc3CACertStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the CA Certificate Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used.

rc3UserCertTable.name: rc3UserCertTable
rc3UserCertTable.description: Table containing the User certificates and public keys that can be used to identify this device to its peers. A public/private key pair will be generated for each entry as it is added to the table. The private keys are stored on the device, but are not readable via SNMP. The index value of 1 is reserved for the User certificate signed by RedCreek CA and is manufactured into the box. Attempts to modify that entry will cause an error.

rc3UserCertEntry.name: rc3UserCertEntry
rc3UserCertEntry.description: The entries in this table can be used as a cache for peer certificates. An attempt to verify the certificate is made when the entry is added to the table.

rc3UserCertIndex.name: rc3UserCertIndex
rc3UserCertIndex.description: A unique identifier for this certificate in this table.

rc3UserCertName.name: rc3UserCertName
rc3UserCertName.description: Textual string used to identify a User certificate.

rc3UserCertData.name: rc3UserCertData
rc3UserCertData.description: The x509v3 DER encoded user certificate.

rc3UserCertStatus.name: rc3UserCertStatus
rc3UserCertStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the User Certificate Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used.

rc3UserCertRDN.name: rc3UserCertRDN
rc3UserCertRDN.description: User Certificate info. used to generate a PKCS10 info. This info. a public/private key pair.

rc3UserCertAlgoId.name: rc3UserCertAlgoId
rc3UserCertAlgoId.description: Algorithm used to sign the hash.

rc3GenerateKeyPair.name: rc3GenerateKeyPair
rc3GenerateKeyPair.description: If the two items above are set then is used to actually to start generating the key pair.

rc3IsakmpProposalTable.name: rc3IsakmpProposalTable
rc3IsakmpProposalTable.description: This table contains a list of ISAKMP phase one proposals.

rc3IsakmpProposalEntry.name: rc3IsakmpProposalEntry
rc3IsakmpProposalEntry.description: An entry in the ISAKMP phase one proposal table.

rc3IsakmpProposalIndx.name: rc3IsakmpProposalIndx
rc3IsakmpProposalIndx.description: This value is used as a unique identifier for entries in this table.

rc3IsakmpProposalEncryption.name: rc3IsakmpProposalEncryption
rc3IsakmpProposalEncryption.description: The encryption type. Currently only des-cbc-56 and 3des-cbc and des-cbc-40 are supported.

rc3IsakmpProposalHash.name: rc3IsakmpProposalHash
rc3IsakmpProposalHash.description: The hash type. Currently md5 and sha are supported.

rc3EspProposalTable.name: rc3EspProposalTable
rc3EspProposalTable.description: This table contains a list of ESP proposals.

rc3EspProposalEntry.name: rc3EspProposalEntry
rc3EspProposalEntry.description: An entry in the ESP proposal table.

rc3EspProposalIndx.name: rc3EspProposalIndx
rc3EspProposalIndx.description: This value is used as a unique identifier for entries in this table.

rc3AhProposalTable.name: rc3AhProposalTable
rc3AhProposalTable.description: This table contains a list of AH proposals.

rc3AhProposalEntry.name: rc3AhProposalEntry
rc3AhProposalEntry.description: An entry in the AH proposal table.

rc3AhProposalIndx.name: rc3AhProposalIndx
rc3AhProposalIndx.description: This value is used as a unique identifier for entries in this table.

rc3EipProposalTable.name: rc3EipProposalTable
rc3EipProposalTable.description: This table contains a list of EIP proposals.

rc3EipProposalEntry.name: rc3EipProposalEntry
rc3EipProposalEntry.description: An entry in the EIP proposal table.

rc3EipProposalIndx.name: rc3EipProposalIndx
rc3EipProposalIndx.description: This value is used as a unique identifier for entries in this table.

rc3PdePeerInfoTable.name: rc3PdePeerInfoTable
rc3PdePeerInfoTable.description: This table contains info. about the remote unit. Remote unit type determines the attributes that are required to be configured. Entries in this table can be added or deleted.

rc3PdePeerInfoEntry.name: rc3PdePeerInfoEntry
rc3PdePeerInfoEntry.description: A Remote unit info entry containing objects to identify remote unit type, DN, Key Mgmt method used, IPSEC protocol to be negotiated, and Next Hop if there is a need to OVERRIDE the routing table.

rc3PdePeerIndx.name: rc3PdePeerIndx
rc3PdePeerIndx.description: A unique numeric ID value for each Pde. This value is used to index into the table.

rc3PdePeerType.name: rc3PdePeerType
rc3PdePeerType.description: The semantics for the different remote unit type is host - need to specify DN, KeyMgmt, and IpsecProtocol (Addr optional) gateway - need to specify DN, KeyMgmt, and IpsecProtocol (Addr optional) bypassboth - need to specify nothing else in this table bypassoutbound - need to specify nothing else in this table

rc3PdePeerAddr.name: rc3PdePeerAddr
rc3PdePeerAddr.description: IP Address of the remote Ravlin unit. This is used for hosts and gateways that have static IP addresses. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the peer is has a dynamic IP address.

rc3PdePeerDN.name: rc3PdePeerDN
rc3PdePeerDN.description: The Distinguished Name of the peer. Can be a Security ID (SID), DER encoded DN, or a DN filter.

rc3PdePeerIssuerDN.name: rc3PdePeerIssuerDN
rc3PdePeerIssuerDN.description: The Distinguished Name of the issuer that signed the peer's certificate. If the SID is being used, then the issuer DN should be null.

rc3PdePeerLocalCertIndx.name: rc3PdePeerLocalCertIndx
rc3PdePeerLocalCertIndx.description: This index corresponds to an entry in the local certificate table, which will determine which local certificate will be used to identify this device to the peer device.

rc3PdePeerKeyMgmtType.name: rc3PdePeerKeyMgmtType
rc3PdePeerKeyMgmtType.description: manual - use manual method to derive session keys. isakmp - use IETF protocol ISAKMP to derive session keys.

rc3PdePeerKeyMgmtIndx.name: rc3PdePeerKeyMgmtIndx
rc3PdePeerKeyMgmtIndx.description: This index corresponds to an entry in either the rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtTable, or an entry in the rc3PdeIsakmpKeyMgmtTable depending on the value of rc3PdePeerKeyMgmtType.

rc3PdePeerIpsecProtocolIndx.name: rc3PdePeerIpsecProtocolIndx
rc3PdePeerIpsecProtocolIndx.description: This index corresponds to an entry in the rc3PdeIpsecProtocolTable, use a value of zero for eip.

rc3PdePeerIfIndex.name: rc3PdePeerIfIndex
rc3PdePeerIfIndex.description: This indicates the interface to use in order to deliver the packet to the Remote unit. If none is specified, then the routing table will be used to determine the next hop.

rc3PdePeerNextHop.name: rc3PdePeerNextHop
rc3PdePeerNextHop.description: If non-zero, then this represents the next hop IP Address used by this Pde. If this value is zero, then use the next hop from the Routing table.

rc3PdePeerContinue.name: rc3PdePeerContinue
rc3PdePeerContinue.description: Allow the packet to continue the Pde selection process when rc3StatConnStatus is failed or dropped.

rc3PdePeerIsakmpLifeType.name: rc3PdePeerIsakmpLifeType
rc3PdePeerIsakmpLifeType.description: The type of key lifetime for ISAKMP phase one.

rc3PdePeerIsakmpLifeTimeSeconds.name: rc3PdePeerIsakmpLifeTimeSeconds
rc3PdePeerIsakmpLifeTimeSeconds.description: The lifetime in seconds for ISAKMP phase one.

rc3PdePeerIsakmpLifeTimeKiloBytes.name: rc3PdePeerIsakmpLifeTimeKiloBytes
rc3PdePeerIsakmpLifeTimeKiloBytes.description: The lifetime in kilobytes for ISAKMP phase one.

rc3PdePeerIpsecLifeType.name: rc3PdePeerIpsecLifeType
rc3PdePeerIpsecLifeType.description: The type of key lifetime for IPsec.

rc3PdePeerIpsecLifeTimeSeconds.name: rc3PdePeerIpsecLifeTimeSeconds
rc3PdePeerIpsecLifeTimeSeconds.description: The lifetime in seconds for IPsec.

rc3PdePeerIpsecLifeTimeKiloBytes.name: rc3PdePeerIpsecLifeTimeKiloBytes
rc3PdePeerIpsecLifeTimeKiloBytes.description: The lifetime in kilobytes for IPsec.

rc3PdePeerRowStatus.name: rc3PdePeerRowStatus
rc3PdePeerRowStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the Policy Database Entry Peer Info Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used. On read status indicates ACTIVE.

rc3PdeFilterProtocol.name: rc3PdeFilterProtocol
rc3PdeFilterProtocol.description: Value specifying an associated IP protocol ID (e.g UDP/TCP). A value of zero means that the protocol ID field should be ignored.

rc3PdeLocalPort.name: rc3PdeLocalPort
rc3PdeLocalPort.description: Value specifying an associated port. A value of zero means that the port field should be ignored.

rc3PdeRemotePort.name: rc3PdeRemotePort
rc3PdeRemotePort.description: Value specifying an associated port. A value of zero means that the port field should be ignored.

rc3PdeName.name: rc3PdeName
rc3PdeName.description: Name used to uniquely identify a PDE. Ravlin firmware will assign a unique Default pdeName value for each PDE inserted, and can be changed.

rc3PdeULA.name: rc3PdeULA
rc3PdeULA.description: If enabled for a gateway PDE ONLY, then each user needs to be authenticated after SA is established. This bit has no meaning for any other type of PDE.

rc3PdePeerLocalInterfaceIpAddr.name: rc3PdePeerLocalInterfaceIpAddr
rc3PdePeerLocalInterfaceIpAddr.description: Specifies remote ravlin's local IP Address. A value of 0 means that this PDE does not participate in polling.

rc3PdeLocalNetworkTable.name: rc3PdeLocalNetworkTable
rc3PdeLocalNetworkTable.description: This table provides the selector list containing 1..n entry pair(s) of network number and mask for the local interface. Entries in this table can be added or deleted.

rc3PdeLocalNetworkEntry.name: rc3PdeLocalNetworkEntry
rc3PdeLocalNetworkEntry.description: An entry in the Local Network Selector Table. Rows are created by an SNMP SET request seeting the value of rc3PdeLocalNetworkRowStatus to 'createAndGo' or 'createAndWait'. Rows are deleted by an SNMP SET request setting the value of rc3PdeLocalNetworkRowStatus to 'destroy'.

rc3PdeLocalNetworkNumber.name: rc3PdeLocalNetworkNumber
rc3PdeLocalNetworkNumber.description: The local network address that will be used to match packets for this entry in the Policy Database.

rc3PdeLocalNetworkMask.name: rc3PdeLocalNetworkMask
rc3PdeLocalNetworkMask.description: The local network mask that will be used to match packets for this entry in the Policy Database.

rc3PdeLocalNetworkRowStatus.name: rc3PdeLocalNetworkRowStatus
rc3PdeLocalNetworkRowStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the Policy Database Entry Local Network Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used. On read status indicates ACTIVE.

rc3PdeRemoteNetworkTable.name: rc3PdeRemoteNetworkTable
rc3PdeRemoteNetworkTable.description: This table provides the selector list containing 1..n entry pair(s) of network number and mask for the Remote interface.

rc3PdeRemoteNetworkEntry.name: rc3PdeRemoteNetworkEntry
rc3PdeRemoteNetworkEntry.description: An entry in the Remote Network Selector Table. Rows are created by an SNMP SET request seeting the value of rc3PdeRemoteNetworkRowStatus to createAndGo or createAndWait. Rows are deleted by an SNMP SET request setting the value of rc3PdeRemoteNetworkRowStatus to destroy.

rc3PdeRemoteNetworkNumber.name: rc3PdeRemoteNetworkNumber
rc3PdeRemoteNetworkNumber.description: The remote network address that will be used to match packets for this entry in the Policy Database.

rc3PdeRemoteNetworkMask.name: rc3PdeRemoteNetworkMask
rc3PdeRemoteNetworkMask.description: The remote network mask that will be used to match packets for this entry in the Policy Database.

rc3PdeRemoteNetworkRowStatus.name: rc3PdeRemoteNetworkRowStatus
rc3PdeRemoteNetworkRowStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the Policy Database Entry Remote Network Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used. On read status indicates ACTIVE.

rc3SAStatTable.name: rc3SAStatTable
rc3SAStatTable.description: This table provides statistics for each Security Association(Pde).

rc3SAStatEntry.name: rc3SAStatEntry
rc3SAStatEntry.description: Entries in table cannot be added or deleted. This table is completely controlled by the agent. Each Pde statistics will be represented by an entry in this table.

rc3SAStatPeerAddr.name: rc3SAStatPeerAddr
rc3SAStatPeerAddr.description: Second index into the stat table. Currently since multiple clients share the policy database entry, this allows stat from all clients sharing this database entry.

rc3SAStatConnStatus.name: rc3SAStatConnStatus
rc3SAStatConnStatus.description: Values 1..4 are controlled by the agent. ONLY value 5, 6, is a read-write value from the manager. Value 5, will block all traffic and 6, will initiate ISAKMP with the remote when it receives the next IP packet that matches the selector.

rc3SAStatCreateTime.name: rc3SAStatCreateTime
rc3SAStatCreateTime.description: Time this Pde was actually established.

rc3SAStatEncryptPktCount.name: rc3SAStatEncryptPktCount
rc3SAStatEncryptPktCount.description: Total encrypted packet count for this Pde, identified by Pde indx.

rc3SAStatEncryptByteCount.name: rc3SAStatEncryptByteCount
rc3SAStatEncryptByteCount.description: Total encrypted byte count for this Pde, identified by Pde indx.

rc3SAStatDecryptPktCount.name: rc3SAStatDecryptPktCount
rc3SAStatDecryptPktCount.description: Total decrypted packet count for this Pde, identified by Pde indx.

rc3SAStatDecryptByteCount.name: rc3SAStatDecryptByteCount
rc3SAStatDecryptByteCount.description: Total decrypted byte count for this Pde, identified by Pde indx.

rc3SAStatReset.name: rc3SAStatReset
rc3SAStatReset.description: SNMP GET/GET NEXT for this object will return value other. SNMP SET request of reset will clear the stat values for row index by rc3PdePeerIndx, and rc3SAStatPeerAddr.

rc3SAStatUserName.name: rc3SAStatUserName
rc3SAStatUserName.description: User name used for RADIUS authentication.

rc3SAStatPollsSent.name: rc3SAStatPollsSent
rc3SAStatPollsSent.description: The number of ICMP polling packets sent through this PDE's tunnel.

rc3SAStatPollsReceived.name: rc3SAStatPollsReceived
rc3SAStatPollsReceived.description: The number of ICMP polling packet responses recieved through this PDE's tunnel.

rc3SAStatPollsAverageTime.name: rc3SAStatPollsAverageTime
rc3SAStatPollsAverageTime.description: The average round trip time on milliseconds of all polling packets.

rc3SAStatPollsMaxTime.name: rc3SAStatPollsMaxTime
rc3SAStatPollsMaxTime.description: The maximum round trip time on milliseconds for a ICMP polling packet.

rc3SAStatPollsMinTime.name: rc3SAStatPollsMinTime
rc3SAStatPollsMinTime.description: The minimum round trip time on milliseconds for a ICMP polling packet.

rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtTable.name: rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtTable
rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtTable.description: Table contains all the required parameters if manual keying method is used to establish an Pde. Entries in this table can be added or deleted. The initial release will allow only one entry (rc3PdeManualIndx = 1).

rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtEntry.name: rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtEntry
rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtEntry.description: Row Entry for Manual Key Mgmt Table.

rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtIndx.name: rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtIndx
rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtIndx.description: This value is used as a unique identifier for entries in this table.

rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtRowStatus.name: rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtRowStatus
rc3PdeManualKeyMgmtRowStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the Policy Database Entry Manual Key Management Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used. On read status indicates ACTIVE.

rc3PdeManualInboundEncryptKeyFips.name: rc3PdeManualInboundEncryptKeyFips
rc3PdeManualInboundEncryptKeyFips.description: Available for release 3.30 and up. Object used to set manual inbound encryption key. Refer to the textual convention of PbeShaEncryptedObject, for the process used to set this object. If the manual inbound encryption key exists, then on read a dummy string is returned. manual inbound encryption key length is (0..24)

rc3PdeManualOutboundEncryptKeyFips.name: rc3PdeManualOutboundEncryptKeyFips
rc3PdeManualOutboundEncryptKeyFips.description: Available for release 3.30 and up. Object used to set manual outbound encryption key. Refer to the textual convention of PbeShaEncryptedObject, for the process used to set this object. If the manual outbound encryption key exists, then on read a dummy string is returned. manual outbound encryption key length is (0..24)

rc3PdeManualInboundAuthKeyFips.name: rc3PdeManualInboundAuthKeyFips
rc3PdeManualInboundAuthKeyFips.description: Available for release 3.30 and up. Object used to set manual inbound authentication key. Refer to the textual convention of PbeShaEncryptedObject, for the process used to set this object. If the manual inbound authentication key exists, then on read a dummy string is returned. manual inbound authentication key length is (0..20)

rc3PdeManualOutboundAuthKeyFips.name: rc3PdeManualOutboundAuthKeyFips
rc3PdeManualOutboundAuthKeyFips.description: Available for release 3.30 and up. Object used to set manual inbound authentication key. Refer to the textual convention of PbeShaEncryptedObject, for the process used to set this object. If the manual inbound authentication key exists, then on read a dummy string is returned. manual outbound authentication key length is (0..20)

rc3PdeIsakmpKeyMgmtTable.name: rc3PdeIsakmpKeyMgmtTable
rc3PdeIsakmpKeyMgmtTable.description: Table contains all the required parameters if ISAKMP keying method is used to establish a Security Association for a Policy Database Entry. The rc3PdeIsakmpIndx value is referenced by the rc3PdePeerKeyMgmtIndx value in the rc3PdePeerInfoTable. Entries in this table can be added or deleted.

rc3PdeIsakmpKeyMgmtEntry.name: rc3PdeIsakmpKeyMgmtEntry
rc3PdeIsakmpKeyMgmtEntry.description: An entry in the ISAKMP Key Management Table.

rc3PdeIsakmpIndx.name: rc3PdeIsakmpIndx
rc3PdeIsakmpIndx.description: This value is used as a unique identifier for entries in this table.

rc3PdeIsakmpProposals.name: rc3PdeIsakmpProposals
rc3PdeIsakmpProposals.description: Each byte in the octet string will specify (in order of preference) the index into the ISAKMP proposal table (rc3IsakmpProposalTable). Up to eight proposals can be entered. These values are used when negotiating the ISAKMP phase one session.

rc3PdeIsakmpRowStatus.name: rc3PdeIsakmpRowStatus
rc3PdeIsakmpRowStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the Policy Database Entry ISAKMP Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used. On read status indicates ACTIVE.

rc3PdeIsakmpAuthPresharedKeyFips.name: rc3PdeIsakmpAuthPresharedKeyFips
rc3PdeIsakmpAuthPresharedKeyFips.description: Available for release 3.30 and up. Object used to set preshared Authentication key. Refer to the textual convention of PbeShaEncryptedObject, for the process used to set this object. If the preshared key exists, then on read a dummy string is returned. Preshared key length is (0..32)

rc3PdeIpsecProtocolTable.name: rc3PdeIpsecProtocolTable
rc3PdeIpsecProtocolTable.description: This table contains sets of IPsec proposals for use when negotiating ESP, AH, or mixed mode Security Associations. The rc3PdeIpsecProtocolIndx value is referenced by the rc3PdePeerIpsecProtocolIndx value in the rc3PdePeerInfoTable.

rc3PdeIpsecProtocolIndx.name: rc3PdeIpsecProtocolIndx
rc3PdeIpsecProtocolIndx.description: This value is used as a unique identifier for entries in this table.

rc3PdeIpsecProtocolType.name: rc3PdeIpsecProtocolType
rc3PdeIpsecProtocolType.description: Indicates the protocol type that the list of Proposals refer to.

rc3PdeIpsecProposals.name: rc3PdeIpsecProposals
rc3PdeIpsecProposals.description: Each byte in the octet string will specify (in order of preference) the index into the ESP or AH proposal table (rc3EspProposalTable or rc3AhProposalTable). Up to eight proposals can be entered. If mixed mode is used, then the first four bytes will specify ESP proposals, and the last four bytes will specify AH proposals. These values are used when negotiating the IPsec session.

rc3PdeIpsecProtocolRowStatus.name: rc3PdeIpsecProtocolRowStatus
rc3PdeIpsecProtocolRowStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the Policy Database Entry IPsec Protocol Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used. On read status indicates ACTIVE.

rc3PdeSelectProtocolTable.name: rc3PdeSelectProtocolTable
rc3PdeSelectProtocolTable.description: This table contains a set of filters for each entry in the Policy Database. If one or more filters exist for a given policy entry, then those filters will be check after a packet has matched the local and remote network selectors. The filters can specify whether to block the packet, pass it in the clear, or use the action specified in the policy entry.

rc3PdeSelectProtocolTableEntry.name: rc3PdeSelectProtocolTableEntry
rc3PdeSelectProtocolTableEntry.description: The table index includes the index from the corresponding policy database entry, as well as the protocol and port. All entries in this table that have the same rc3PdePeerIndx value will be used to determine the disposition of packets that match that policy entry.

rc3PdeSelectAction.name: rc3PdeSelectAction
rc3PdeSelectAction.description: This variable determines how the packet should be handled if it matches this selection entry. block - drop the packet pass - pass the packet in the clear operational - use the rc3PdePeerType value in the corresponding rc3PdePerrInfoTable to determine how to handle the packet

rc3PdeSelectRowStatus.name: rc3PdeSelectRowStatus
rc3PdeSelectRowStatus.description: This object is used to create/delete rows from the Policy Database Entry Select Protocol Table. See the definition for RowStatus for a range of valid values used. On read status indicates ACTIVE.

rc3PdeCount.name: rc3PdeCount
rc3PdeCount.description: The count of number of Pde(s) completely configured on the Ravlin unit.

rc3PdePeerPreference.name: rc3PdePeerPreference
rc3PdePeerPreference.description: This indicates the searc3h order for the Pde list. The list is ordered in the ascending order; i.e Pde with the lowest preference value has the highest priority.

rc3PdeNextAvailableIndx.name: rc3PdeNextAvailableIndx
rc3PdeNextAvailableIndx.description: The next available unique indx for the manager to create a instance of the PDE Peer Info. table entry.

comments: Produced by pysmi-0.3.4 at Tue Apr 20 16:02:03 2021
